title: What Has Made Oasisâ€™ Live â€™25 Tour So Special (Beyond It Actually Happening In the FirstÂ Place)?
summary: This bonus Greatest Pop Stars podcast episode looks at two concerts on the tour that Andrew and his partner Lisa went to, and why the experience ended up being such a profound one.
body: If you listened to our 1996 Oasis Vintage Pop Stardom episode of the Greatest Pop Stars podcast , you’d know that host Andrew Unterberger and his longtime partner Lisa Ebe were planning on going to see Oasis on the Live ’25 tour in Dublin, Ireland last month â€” but were hardly positive that the Gallagher Brothers would make it to the show in tact. But not only has the full band made it to each of the 22 dates on its much-anticipated stadium tour â€” the lads’ first tour of any kind since breaking up in 2009 â€” but Oasis has been receiving the best reviews, the most attention and the overall greatest feelings that it’s been able to claim since the mid-’90s, when it was arguably the biggest band in the world. In this bonus Pop Star Performance Review episode of Greatest Pop Stars, Andrew is once again joined by Lisa to discuss the Oasis show they saw at Croke Park in Dubin â€” and also the second Live ’25 show they saw a couple weeks later, much closer to their New York hometown at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. They compare and contrast the two shows and the two experiences of seeing the band, and try to capture exactly what â€¦

title: Executive Turntable: Sony Music Publishing Taps MD of Iberia, Plus Bruce Allen Names Successor at NamesakeÂ Firm
summary: Your weekly roundup of promotions, hires, exits and openings across music.
body: S ony Music Publishing elevated Jordi Tello to managing director of Iberia, succeeding longtime Spain MD Juan Ignacio Alonso , who retired in August. Based in Madrid, Tello will oversee creative and business operations across Spain and Portugal, reporting to SMP president of international Guy Henderson. Tello joined SMP in April 2024 as A&R director, working with top artists like Rels B, Morad, Rigoberta Bandini, and Vicco, while SMP Iberia continues to represent iconic talent such as Jose Luis Perales, Estopa, RozalÃ©n and Love of Lesbian. With over 25 years of experience, Tello began his career as a musician before transitioning into the music business in 1999 as an A&R for Warner Music, later spending 15 years at Universal Music Publishing â€” ultimately as A&R director â€” before joining Sony Music as an A&R director in 2017 and returning to publishing at SMP in 2024. Henderson praised Telloâ€™s leadership and industry acumen, while Alonso expressed confidence in his successor. “I am delightedâ€¦ and feel confident that the amazing work achieved by SMP Iberia’s current and former teams will be pursued and fostered under his leadership,” he said. Canadiâ€¦

title: Friday Music Guide: New Music From Justin Bieber, Lady Gaga, Drake andÂ More
summary: Check out the must-hear releases of the week.
body: Billboardâ€™s Friday Music Guide serves as a handy guide to this Fridayâ€™s most essential releases â€” the key music that everyone will be talking about today, and that will be dominating playlists this weekend and beyond.  This week, Justin Bieber shows us more Swag , Lady Gaga dances into fall and Drakeâ€™s Iceman cometh. Check out all of this weekâ€™s picks below: Justin Bieber, Swag II Less than two months after shocking the world with both a new album ( Swag ) and a new sound (sparse, chilled-out indie-R&B), Justin Bieber has unveiled another surprise: Swag II , a 23-song sequel that follows a similar sonic template but offers plenty of new lyrical musings on Bieberâ€™s unique place in pop — as well as guest spots from Tems, Eddie Benjamin and, most amazingly, Hurricane Chris, of â€œA Bay Bayâ€ fame. Lady Gaga, â€œThe Dead Danceâ€ Lady Gaga continues an all-star year, even by her very high standards — from the chart-topping â€œDie With a Smileâ€ to the crowd-pleasing Mayhem to the rave reviews of her current world tour — with an appearance on the Netflix series Wednesday , and the companion song â€œThe Dead Dance,â€ which actualizes the viral â€œBloody Maryâ€ trend from lastâ€¦

title: Here Are the Performers and Presenters for the 2025 VMAs: FullÂ List
summary: The women behind HUNTR/X, whose "Golden" is the current No. 1 single on the Billboard Hot 100, will present on the show.
body: UPDATE (Sept. 5): Aerosmith â€™s Steven Tyler & Joe Perry , YUNGBLUD and Nuno Bettencourt will join forces to honor the late Ozzy Osbourne with a medley of his greatest hits on the 2025 MTV Video Music Awards, which are set for Sunday Sept. 7. Osbourne, a two-time Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee, died on July 22 at age 76. PREVIOUSLY (Sept. 2): Mariah Carey , Lady Gaga , Tate McRae , Alex Warren and Sabrina Carpenter , all of whom have topped the Billboard Hot 100 in 2025, are among the artists set to perform on the MTV Video Music Awards on Sunday (Sept. 7). Related Lady Gaga & Bruno Mars Are 1-2 in Nominations for 2025 MTV VMAs (Full List) Tate McRae, Sabrina Carpenter & More Nominated in Social Categories at 2025 VMAs: Full List Mariah Carey to Receive Video Vanguard Award & Perform at 2025 MTV VMAs Also, the women behind HUNTR/X, whose â€œGoldenâ€ is the current No. 1 single on the Hot 100, will present on the show. The fictional trio from KPop Demon Hunters is voiced by EJAE, Rei Ami and Audrey Nuna. Carey will receive this yearâ€™s Video Vanguard Award and will perform a career-spanning medley of hits. Hosted by LL COOL J , the show is set to aiâ€¦

title: IFA 2025: NexLawn debuts and teams up with MOVA to showcase lawn and garden care innovations
summary: NexLawn stole the show at IFA2025 with robotic mowers that do more than cut grass.
body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority Robot lawn mowers have come a long way in a short time, taking the pain away from the otherwise physically-intensive and time-consuming chore. Automating lawn care allows you to enjoy your outdoor space without wasting time on maintenance, thanks to continuous innovations that make things smarter, faster, and, most importantly, easier. At IFA 2025, one of the brands leading the charge is NexLawn , a new member of the MOVA group focused on smart tools and yard tech. Making its debut at the event, NexLawn unveiled a groundbreaking portfolio of robotic lawn care solutions, including a visionary lawn mower that takes things to the next level. Hereâ€™s everything you need to know.

title: Galaxy S26 Edge leaked renders point to slim body, not-so-slim camera bump
summary: These renders are giving iPhone 17 Pro vibes with that chunky camera bump.
body: Credit: Android Headlines New CAD renders of the Galaxy S26 Edge show a ridiculously large camera island, seemingly inspired by the upcoming iPhone 17 Pro. The Galaxy S26 Edge could be thinner than its predecessor at its thinnest point, but this three-tiered camera bump could make it thicker overall. Previous leaks suggest the entire Galaxy S26 lineup could feature Qi2 magnets for wireless charging. Samsungâ€™s Galaxy S26 series isnâ€™t due until early next year, but just yesterday, we got a good look at dummy units that showcased some interesting changes, like magnets across the lineup and a rather interesting look for the Galaxy S26 Edge. Now, new CAD renders give us an even better look at the Galaxy S26 Edge, and weâ€™re getting a lot of iPhone 17 Pro vibes from it. Android Headlines has shared CAD renders of the Galaxy S26 Edge. These renders give us a good look at the device and reveal its dimensions.

title: Samsung wasnâ€™t even the second-most popular foldable maker in Q2 2025
summary: Sure, this was the quarter before Samsung's big foldable launch, but Motorola is certainly doing something right.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Samsung only accounted for third place in foldable phone shipments in Q2 2025, according to Counterpoint Research. HUAWEI was in first place, while Motorola was the runner-up. This report doesnâ€™t take Samsungâ€™s latest foldables into account, as they launched in Q3. Foldable phones only account for a small number of smartphones shipping globally, but a new market share report has revealed some bad news for Samsung for Q2 2025. Counterpoint Research has published its foldable phone market share report for Q2 2025, and it turns out HUAWEI was on top with a 45% share. This is a significant boost from a year ago, when it held 32% of the market. The tracking firm attributed these results to the Chinese market, saying it accounts for the majority of foldable phone shipments globally. Furthermore, foldable shipments in general saw a 45% year-on-year increase.

title: Hereâ€™s Whoâ€™s Performing a Tribute to Ozzy Osbourne at 2025 MTVÂ VMAs
summary: The network announced an all-star line-up for the homage slated to take place during Sunday's (Sept. 7) broadcast.
body: The Prince of Darkness will have another moment in the light on Sunday (Sept. 7) when some of Ozzy Osbourne ‘s musical compatriots and biggest fans will take the stage to honor the late metal legend at the 2025 MTV VMAs. According to a release announcing the special tribute, Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler and guitarist Joe Perry will join Yungblud and Extreme’s Nuno Bettencourt during this year’s awards broadcast, which will air live on CBS beginning at 8 p.m. ET. Related Jack Osbourne Reveals How He Found Out Dad Ozzy Osbourne Died: ‘I Just Knew Something Bad Had Happened’ Jack Osbourne Trashes ‘Pathetic and Out of Touch’ Roger Waters Over Ozzy Osbourne Diss: ‘F–k You’ Here Are the Performers and Presenters for the 2025 VMAs: Full List The rockers will take the stage to honor the Prince of Darkness with a medley of his greatest hits on the program that will be hosted by LL Cool J. In addition to being one of the most beloved figures in hard rock, Osbourne also had a storied history with MTV, from appearing on Headbanger’s Ball in the 1980s to sharing his private life with the world on the wildly popular faâ€¦

title: Love the Pixel 10? You can now wear it on your sleeve, almost literally
summary: After Pixel Drop, it's time for some merch drop!
body: Credit: Google Google has launched new Pixel 10-themed merchandise. The T-Shirt, ceramic mug, and a roll of washi tape, all come with a coded message. Besides online, Google will also sell these items in its physical stores across the US. Google has just dropped a new set of merchandise in succession of the Pixel 10 series phones announced last month. The newly added products include a coffee mug, a full-sleeve T-shirt, and a roll of washi tape. All of these products are available in black and have a series of binary numbers printed on them. I asked Google Lens to scan and interpret these numbers for me, and I was informed that it reads â€œ72 101 108 111 33â€ in decimal digits. Without me asking, the built-in AI also interpreted that these numbers represented the positions of various English alphabet letters in the list of ASCII characters, so I didnâ€™t have to use my own brain cells trying to decode them.

title: The Galaxy Tab S11 family is here, but should you upgrade from your older Galaxy tablet?
summary: It's not about how old your existing tablet is, but whether or not the Galaxy Tab S11 will provide a meaningful upgrade.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority While many of us still upgrade smartphones every 2â€“4 years on average, tablets tend to have a much longer shelf life. Theyâ€™re typically used less often and for narrower purposes like video consumption or light productivity. With the arrival of the Galaxy Tab S11 and Tab S11 Ultra , you might be wondering whether now is finally the right time to replace your aging Galaxy tablet. The answer here isnâ€™t so cut and dry. Itâ€™s really less about age and more about whether the new models deliver a meaningful improvement to your existing experience. Letâ€™s dive in a bit deeper and take a look at some of the past models to get a better idea of whether an upgrade is right for you.

title: Police Say Former Mastodon Guitarist Brent Hinds Was at Fault in Deadly MotorcycleÂ Crash
summary: Hinds died on Aug. 20 in Atlanta when his Harley collided with a BMW SUV.
body: Atlanta police said that Mastodon co-founder Brent Hinds, 51, was at fault in the motorcycle crash that took his life on the night of Aug. 20. According to Atlanta New First , the details are in contrast to the initial findings in the investigation that put the fault on the 22-year-old driver of the BMW SUV that Hinds crashed into for allegedly failing to yield at an intersection. Related Mastodon Pays Tribute to Brent Hinds at First Show Since Guitarist’s Death: ‘Brothers to the End’ Justin Bieber Doubles Down on 'Swag II': Stream It Now Tones And I Will Perform At 2025 NBA Series In Melbourne The updated police report on the incident involving the former Mastodon guitarist said that, “After conducting time distance calculations of the Motorcycle and assessing the changes in velocity of the BMW it was deemed that Hinds was traveling between 63 and 68 mph. Video of the intersection was used for the calculations. The video clearly depicts the crash. Hinds was at fault for the crash.â€ Hinds’ speed at the time of the deadly accident was reportedly twice the speed limit at the crash site, with two eyewitnesses telling the police that the guâ€¦

title: Kelly Clarkson Returns to Instagram After Former Husbandâ€™s Death With Sentimental â€˜Idolâ€™ Post: â€˜It Is a Gift to Find YourÂ Purposeâ€™
summary: The singer had been off her socials since ex Brandon Blackstock's death last month.
body: Kelly Clarkson returned to Instagram on Thursday (Sept. 4) for the first time since the death of her ex-husband Brandon Blackstock last month. In a sentimental post tied to the 23rd anniversary of her life-changing American Idol win on Sept. 4, 2022 that capped the iconic music competition’s first season, Clarkson gave thanks for the moment that changed everything. Related Here’s When ‘The Kelly Clarkson Show’ Will Return for New Episodes (And New Kellyoke Covers) Old Dominion Says Kenny Chesney 'Definitely Is Deserving' of Country Music Hall of Fame Honor Ahead of 'Swag II,' Justin Bieber Scores His First Music Video With 4 Billion Views on YouTube “To everyone that took time 23 years ago to call in and vote for me, thank you ğŸ™ Winning American Idol changed my life and I will be forever grateful for all of you that have supported me for so many years,” Clarkson wrote alongside a photo of her being embraced by her cast mates in the midst of a confetti tsunami. “It is a gift to find your purpose and passion, and to be able to make a living doing it is the cherry on top. Thank you, always.” After coming out onâ€¦

title: This dual-4K security camera with 360Âº panning uses AI to alert you of porch pirates
summary: While the app offers AI-powered searching and event summaries.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority Reolink is expanding its security camera solutions with AI-powered event summaries and natural language searching. The brand has also announced TrackFlex Floodlight WiFi, a new wireless camera with AI-based 360Âº panning and object tracking. It features two cameras that combine to provide a 4K video feed. AI is creeping into every facet of our lives, and so, itâ€™s not surprising for it to make way into our security cameras . Reolink recently introduced a new spin on the concept by unveiling an AI-based system designed to simplify the process of reviewing security camera footage. And now, it is showcasing a more robust system that can potentially save hours of manual scrubbing. Reolink has announced an upgraded version of its ReoNeura AI system, which allows you to search for specific objects or individuals based on natural language instructions. Its Smart Detection functionality already enables you to scope out particular objects, such as a â€œgray truckâ€ or a â€œperson in black pants.â€ You can also scan for pets â€” or other animals, people, and even detect exactly when packages arrive or are taken away. It alerts you immediately so you can catâ€¦

title: The first Snapdragon 8 Elite handheld has an unbelievably low price, but only if you act fast
summary: The AYN Odin 3 launches this weekend, and prices are much lower than expected.
body: Credit: AYN The AYN Odin 3 will start at $299 for the first 48 hours of the Indiegogo campaign. Retail pricing starts at $349, with the 24+1TB version maxing out at $549. The campaign launches on September 7 at 9:30 AM CST. Right in time for the weekend, AYN has finally announced pricing on its upcoming Odin 3 handheld. A clear upgrade over the Odin 2, itâ€™s the first handheld to officially feature a Snapdragon 8 Elite, and itâ€™s significantly cheaper than expected. Pricing for the Odin 3 starts at $299 for the base 8+128GB model, jumping up to $499 for the maxed-out 24+1TB model. However, thereâ€™s a catch. Those are the â€œSuper Early Birdâ€ prices, and theyâ€™re only valid for the first 48 hours of the Indiegogo campaign.

title: Survey reveals a close battle for best Pixel 10 Pro alternative
summary: Readers voted for the OnePlus 13 as the top Pixel 10 Pro alternative, narrowly beating the Galaxy S25.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Google launched the Pixel 10 series last month, and the Pixel 10 Pro continues the trend of offering great camera hardware in a pocket-friendly design. Otherwise, it offers plenty of AI features, a relatively large battery, and seven years of updates. Colleague Joe Maring recently looked at some alternative phones to the Pixel 10 Pro. He also included a poll asking for your favorite alternative phone. Well, the results are in, and hereâ€™s what you told us.

title: I tested the Pixel 10â€™s charging with Googleâ€™s own 67W brick, and itâ€™s still disappointingly slow
summary: Google seems worried about Pixel 10 battery temperatures.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Googleâ€™s Pixel series has, to be blunt, always been pretty slow to charge. Even the Pixel 9 Pro XLâ€™s boost to 37W (about 35W effective) still left the phone taking a sluggish 77 minutes to reach full, while the regular 26W capabilities of the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro left last yearâ€™s users waiting about 85 minutes. Nothing has changed for the better with the new Pixel 10 series . In fact, after testing Googleâ€™s latest flagships with the companyâ€™s new 67W USB-C charger , the situation is in some ways worse than before. Iâ€™ll let the graphs do the talking.

title: Solid-state power banks are ready to keep you juiced â€” without burning all your stuff
summary: BMX's new SolidSafe battery packs deliver both wireless convenience and unparalleled damage resistance.
body: BMX is bringing solid-state tech to battery packs with a 5,000mAh and 10,000mAh solution. Solid-state construction allows these batteries to take serious damage and keep right on running. Magnetic Qi charging also makes them perfect for pairing with a new Pixel 10. Lithium-ion batteries have been an utter game-changer for mobile devices, making possible everything from our smartphones to practical electric cars. But for all the power they can offer, their construction comes at a perilous disadvantage: Itâ€™s far too easy to damage one, and that risks the battery becoming a serious fire hazard. One of the best solutions weâ€™ve come up with for fixing that problem is replacing the liquid electrolyte that mobilizes the charge in these cells with a mostly solid alternative: so-called solid-state batteries . Not only does that kind of design improve power density (so smaller batteries can hold more charge), but it also wildly improves durability â€” and resistance to catastrophic failure.

title: Travis Kelce Jokes About the Biggest Change in His Life Since Taylor Swift Engagement: â€˜I Got One More Ring ForÂ Itâ€™
summary: Trav's QB, Patrick Mahomes, also told Brazilian media that they need to update their references to the pop star now that she's betrothed.
body: As we’ve learned from watching the New Heights podcast, Travis Kelce ‘s got jokes. Which is why it was no surprise when the Kansas City Chiefs’ three-time Super Bowl champ had a pithy quip when asked by reporters on Thursday (Sept. 4) to describe the biggest change in his life since recently getting engaged to longtime love Taylor Swift . Related NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell Reveals Whether Taylor Swift Is in the Mix For 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Justin Bieber Doubles Down on 'Swag II': Stream It Now Travis Kelce Talks Proposing to Taylor Swift for the ‘Right Reasons,’ Says Calling Her His ‘FiancÃ©e’ Makes Him ‘Giddy’ “I got one more ring for it, two if we’re counting the first Super Bowl, ” Kelce said at a news conference in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil in advance of the Chiefs’ season kick-off game against the Los Angeles Chargers, according to the Associated Press . “I would say ever since I’ve been dating Taylor, life has been fun.” And though he did not bite on a question about whether Swift was going to be in the house at Corinthians Arena for Friday night’s (Sept. 5) gaâ€¦

title: NZ great Taylor makes comeback with Samoa
summary: New Zealand great Ross Taylor is coming out of retirement at the age of 41 to play for Samoa in a T20 World Cup qualifier.

title: Everyoneâ€™s in awe of â€˜tri-foldâ€™ phones, and now projectors are all â€˜yeah, us, tooâ€™
summary: The Aurzen ZIP brings foldable design to projectors to deliver new viewing options and enhance portability.
body: The Aurzen ZIP projector has a Z-shaped folding design that collapses to just one inch thick. A 5,000 mAh battery delivers 90 minutes of operation on a charge. In addition to the folding design letting you easily direct the ZIPâ€™s output, you can turn it on its side for screen-mirroring portrait mode. Listen, foldables are cool â€” who doesnâ€™t love big things that transform into smaller things â€” but theyâ€™re also becoming a little been-there-done-that as manufacturers really start getting comfortable with the form factor. And that sort of familiarity is probably exactly why so many of us have been shifting our interests slightly towards the growing crop of â€œtri-foldâ€ devices like Samsungâ€™s upcoming TriFold or the new Mate XTs . Editorâ€™s note: When did the mobile industry forget how to count? All these things fold twice , not three times. Get it together.

title: Google leaks its new Nest Cams and Nest Doorbell inside the Home app
summary: The new Nest devices could feature a better camera and new Gemini-powered features.
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority Images and mentions of the upcoming Nest Cam Indoor, Nest Cam Outdoor, and Nest Doorbell have been spotted in the latest Google Home app update. Previous leaks suggest all the devices could feature 2K video recording, digital zoom up to 6x with Zoom and Crop, support for Gemini, and come in multiple color options. Google is preparing to launch some new Nest-branded products. The company sneakily teased a new Gemini-equipped Nest speaker at the Pixel 10 â€˜s launch event. Thanks to a leak, weâ€™ve also gotten a look at new Nest-branded cameras and a doorbell . Weâ€™ve now spotted more images of the Nest Cam and Nest Doorbell, and they come straight from Google itself. Weâ€™ve spotted mentions of Googleâ€™s upcoming Nest devices within the latest version of the Google Home app.

title: IFA 2025 Highlight: MAMMOTIONâ€™s Tri-Fusion Positioning System takes its robot lawn mowers to the next level
summary: MAMMOTION Tri-Fusion Positioning System fuses LiDAR, RTK, and Vision for wire-free, Â±1cm precision lawn care on any terrain.
body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority Robot mowers may seem like a niche product, but the amount of time you save and the physical labor you avoid from not having to mow your own lawn canâ€™t be stated enough. It started with low-powered devices that would get stuck on slopes and required physical boundaries that were difficult to install. But these robots have evolved exponentially since, with current generation robot mowers able to navigate using virtual boundaries and handle different types of terrain. No robot lawn mower was perfect, though, with navigation and terrain struggles remaining significant pain points. Thatâ€™s exactly what MAMMOTION hopes to address with its latest Tri-Fusion Positioning System on the new LUBA mini AWD LiDAR, which the company is showcasing at IFA 2025. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.

summary: The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra is undoubtedly a pro-grade upgrade, but the standard Tab S11 is the better fit for most people.
body: Itâ€™s that time of the year when Samsung updates its premium tablet lineup alongside launching a new FE phone . The Galaxy Tab S11 series is out now , but this time it looks a little different. Thereâ€™s no Plus or Pro model to speak of â€” just the standard Galaxy Tab S11 and its uber-packed, equally uber-expensive Ultra sibling. The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra does give you a few extras besides that massive screen, but if you ask me, Iâ€™d stick with the standard model. Hereâ€™s why.

title: The first Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 phones could have ridiculously big batteries
summary: The Xiaomi 16 series will be the first next-gen Snapdragon-powered phones, and a leak reveals stupendously large batteries.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority A new Xiaomi 16 series leak suggests major battery upgrades across the board. This varies from 7,000mAh for the compact Xiaomi 16 all the way to 7,500mAh for the purported Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. These will be the first phones with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Gen 2) processors. Xiaomi will be the first Android brand to offer phones with the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 2) processor. However, it looks like all three of these upcoming phones could bring impressive batteries. Leaker Yogesh Brar has claimed on Twitter that three Xiaomi 16 series phones are coming, namely the Xiaomi 16, the Xiaomi 16 Pro, and the Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. Furthermore, the tipster says the standard model will have a 7,000mAh battery, the Pro model will have a 6,300mAh battery, and the Pro Max model will top out at 7,500mAh.

title: 7 features Iâ€™m excited to try when Gemini lands on my Google Home speakers
summary: Gemini is more versatile, more powerful, and more suited for use around the house than Assistant ever was.
body: Credit: Adam Molina / Android Authority Gemini support on Google Home and Nest speakers has been a long time coming. The feature has been in preview testing for some lucky US users with specific voices for months now, but Google just announced the exact date when itâ€™ll start showing up for real : October 1. Although this will still be an early access, I canâ€™t wait to get my proverbial hands on it because Iâ€™m sick of Google Assistantâ€™s glitches . The inconsistency, frequent bugs, and silly downgrades have taken the joy out of using a â€œsmartâ€ speaker, to a point where I find myself arguing with it more often than using it. Gemini, however, has been a lot more interesting to use on my Pixel phones and watches, and I canâ€™t help but think that this will be a huge upgrade for everyone. Hereâ€™s why.

title: Justin Bieberâ€™s â€˜Swag IIâ€™: All 23 TracksÂ Ranked
summary: Billboard sizes up the 23 new songs on Bieber's semi-surprise sequel set.
body: Swag, swag, swag… on II . The suddenly very prolific pop superstar Justin Bieber announced over social media on Thursday (Sept. 4) that midnight would bring with it the surprise sequel to his equally unexpected Swag album from July. Midnight came and went without the suddenly highly anticipated release, but just around 3:30 a.m. ET, the set appeared on YouTube, trickling to other DSPs shortly after. Swag II was now officially with us. The 23-track set follows in the organic-sounding, warm-feeling alt-R&B mode of the first Swag , with many of the same sonic architects (Dijon, Carter Lang, Mk.gee), and even a couple overlapping feature guests in Lil B and Eddie Benjamin. New to the Swag is Afrobeats star Tems, British singer-songwriter Bakar and ’00s Louisiana rapper Hurricane Chris. But no skits this time â€” Druski makes nary an appearance across the set, although “I’m not the one” and “It’s not clocking to you” references are both made in the album’s lyrics. And the blockbuster sequel closes with the longest Bieber album cut to date: “Story of God,” a nearly eight-minute spoken-word retelling of the Adam and Eve â€¦

title: Android 16 QPR1 made my Pixel 9 Pro feel just like a Pixel 10 Pro
summary: Yes, Material 3 Expressive really does feel like a breath of fresh air.
body: Believe it or not, Iâ€™m not usually one to load up beta software. Itâ€™s cool to try new Android features before theyâ€™re fully baked, but I run into more hiccups than Iâ€™d usually like along the way. However, when Google announced that the Android 16 QPR1 beta was ready for older Pixels, I let my curiosity get the better of me. I wondered what features I would get and which wouldnâ€™t be ready yet. So, I did what only a tech reviewer can: I loaded Android 16 on my Pixel 9 Pro XL to see if it could match my Pixel 10 Pro XL. Hereâ€™s what I found out along the way.

title: Justin Bieber Doubles Down on â€˜Swag IIâ€™: Stream ItÂ Now
summary: The pop star's new LP comes just a couple of months after the first Swag dropped in July.
body: Things just got swaggier. In the small hours of Friday morning (Sept. 3), Justin Bieber unleashed new album Swag II with just a short warning. Related Justin Bieber Reveals ‘Swag II’ Album Coming Even Sooner Than You Think Justin Bieber’s ‘Swag II’: All 23 Tracks Ranked Scooter Braun Shares His Opinion on Justin Bieber’s ‘Swag’ Coming just a couple of months after the release of the pop star’s first Swag album, Swag II arrived after Bieber announced its existence via a slew of electronic billboards in different cities on Thursday (Sept. 4). As opposed to Swag ‘s black-and-white visuals featuring photography of the singer and his family, Swag II ‘s color scheme was established as baby pink in the billboards and in posts on Bieber’s Instagram. Disc 1 is the new release, and features 23 new cuts, led off by “Speed Demon,” “Better Man” and “Love Song.” The surprise release of Swag II aligns with the way Bieber dropped Swag , similarly giving fans hardly any heads up before heralding its arrival a few hours prior with electronic advertisements earlier this summer. The aâ€¦

title: OnePlus ends Hasselblad camera partnership, reveals whatâ€™s next for OnePlus 15 and beyond
summary: The Hasselblad partnership makes way for an in-house imaging engine dubbed OnePlus DetailMax Engine.
body: Credit: OnePlus OnePlus has announced the end of its partnership with camera maker Hasselblad. Instead, the mobile brand is working on its own OnePlus DetailMax Engine for photography. The Hasselblad partnership kicked off with 2021â€™s OnePlus 9 Pro. OnePlus first teamed up with Hasselblad for 2021â€™s OnePlus 9 series. This partnership spawned Hasselblad-branded OnePlus flagship phones all the way until the OnePlus 13 . Now, the smartphone maker has confirmed that this tie-up is over. OnePlus co-founder Pete Lau noted in an official blog post that the companyâ€™s â€œplanned chapterâ€ with Hasselblad was now complete after five years. So whatâ€™s next?

title: Another Pixel, another 911 failure: Pixel 10 users say emergency calls sound like screeches
summary: Previous Pixels have also been unreliable in calling 911, and the Pixel 10 seems to be failing too, albeit differently.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Pixel 10 series users report that they cannot reliably make 911 calls. The 911 call connects but only delivers garbled, incomprehensible audio, described as â€œshrill electronic screeches.â€ Googleâ€™s Pixel series has had a long history of not connecting 911 calls. This bug is technically different, but the end result is the same. Googleâ€™s Pixel lineup has an unfortunate history of being unable to make 911 calls, a statement that doesnâ€™t incite confidence at all. Reports first emerged in 2021 about Pixels being unable to connect to 911, and the issue was traced to a Microsoft Teams bug and fixed in 2022. More 911 call failure reports emerged in 2023 on Pixels, but Google never acknowledged the problem or publicly issued a fix. It seems even the Pixel 10 series cannot make 911 calls reliably, and thatâ€™s frankly scary at this point. Reddit user YellowWidget had to call 911 for an emergency. Unlike previous Pixels, the call went through. However, the user only heard what they describe as â€œgarbled beeps, shrill electronic screeches, and the occasional ghost of a human word buried in the noise.â€ The user tried four times, but faced the same issue.â€¦

title: This YouTube TV discount for existing subscribers is too good to miss
summary: It's essentially 40% off, but only for the first two months, unfortunately.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority YouTube TV is getting a temporary $33 discount for existing users. This brings the cost down to $49.99 a month. You only get the discounted price for two months, but a $66 benefit is better than none. If youâ€™ve switched over from a traditional cable TV, you probably know about virtual providers like YouTube TV, DirecTV, or Hulu. However, if you havenâ€™t and want to explore cutting ties with a traditional TV operator, YouTube TV could be one of the more beneficial options. The base pack starts at $82.99, which isnâ€™t cheap but feels justified for the features it offers . And for its existing customers, YouTube TV is introducing a new discount offer that saves $33 per month. Reddit user oestred recently discovered a discount offer that reduces the monthly cost to $49.99, resulting in a $33 monthly savings. However, you must note that the offer applies only for two months, and your subscription costs will revert to the original price from the third month onwards. Despite that, it doesnâ€™t sound like a bad deal, but you must act quickly, since we donâ€™t know how long the offer will last.

title: The best Switch emulator just got a big update, with support for Silksong
summary: Silksong is just the icing on the cake of an otherwise massive update.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority The official stable release 0.0.3 of the Switch emulator Eden is now available. It adds performance updates, driver downloads, UI improvements, and bug fixes. The update also adds support for Hollow Knight: Silksong, which released just yesterday. Itâ€™s been just over a month since the Nintendo Switch emulator Eden dropped the release candidate for version 0.0.3, but after a few rounds of revisions, itâ€™s finally ready for a stable release. The Yuzu fork adds a ton of new features and improvements, plus improved game compatibility. For starters, the update features a number of Vulkan, JIT, and CMake bug fixes, which should provide a small performance boost on all machines. That includes Windows, Linux, and of course, Android.

title: PSA: Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger isnâ€™t the same everywhere
summary: It might be missing one travel-friendly feature depending on where you buy it.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger may be missing one feature depending on where you buy it. Users on Reddit point out that the chargerâ€™s prongs donâ€™t fold as advertised on Googleâ€™s website and Amazon. The lack of foldable prongs may be limited to specific regions, though. Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger is surely one of the best accessories you can buy for your Pixel 10 phone. The $59.99 USB-C fast charger uses proprietary tech that can not only prioritize charging your Pixel but also charge a second device simultaneously. Another small but cool advantage of the charger is that itâ€™s supposed to be very travel-friendly, with prongs that fold inside, making it easy to carry around in a small bag without the prongs awkwardly poking out.

title: This new Qi2 25W wireless charger lineup is ready for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and iPhone 17 series
summary: UGREEN's new MagFlow Qi2 25W line includes power banks, wireless charging pads, and multi-device chargers.
body: UGREENâ€™s new MagFlow Qi2 25W line of accessories is designed for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and the upcoming iPhone 17 series. The MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup includes a 10,000mAh power bank, a wireless charging pad, and two- and three-in-one charging stations. The Pixel 10 Pro XL supports Qi2 25W wireless charging, while other Pixel 10 models are limited to 15W. All iPhone 17 series phones are expected to feature Qi2 25W wireless charging. One of the biggest highlights of the Pixel 10 series is Pixelsnap , Googleâ€™s branding for Qi2-based magnets baked into the phones. This allows the Pixel 10 series to be used with a wide variety of Qi2 accessories. If you just grabbed a new Pixel 10 series phone and wanted to get a few accessories to complement it, UGREEN has launched its new MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup for faster magnetic charging. Every Pixel 10 model supports Qi2 charging, but thereâ€™s some nuance involved that you should be aware of. The Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold top out at 15W with Qi2-certified chargers when paired with a 20W or higher USB-C adapter. On the other hand, the Pixel 10 Pro XL steps things up with Qi2.2 support, hitting 25W when used with a Qi2.2-certified châ€¦

title: The DuRoBo Krono e-reader boasts open Android and a built-in audio player
summary: There's a fresh face in the e-reader crowd.
body: DuRoBo has unveiled its Krono E-Ink tablet at IFA Berlin, calling it an â€œAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.â€ The device combines a 6.13-inch E-Ink Carta 1200 display (300ppi) with AI note capture, audio playback, and open Android. It is available for Kickstarter pre-sale now for â‚¬279.99, with shipping expected in November 2025. Most e-readers stick to the basics: an E-Ink screen, a bookstore tie-in, and enough battery to survive a long vacation. At IFA 2025, DuRoBo debuted a more ambitious device, the Krono, pitched as an â€œAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.â€ This is either a mouthful of marketing or a peek at where these types of devices are indeed headed. On paper (pun intended), the specs look solid. The Krono features a 6.13-inch Carta 1200 HD display at 300ppi with an 18:9 aspect ratio. Under the hood, it runs on an octa-core processor with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, a big jump from the 1GB RAM and 16GB storage youâ€™ll find on most e-readers like a Kindle or Kobo. Powering those beefier internals is a 3,950mAh battery, though DuRoBo hasnâ€™t shared an actual usage estimate.

title: These cool earbuds bring crazy translation smarts for your travels
summary: The W4 earbuds are a little cheaper than the Pro model while bringing a more conventional design.
body: Credit: Supplied by Timekettle Timekettle has launched the W4 translation earbuds. These earbuds offer a more conventional earbud design but still offer real-time translation and automatic mode switching. The earbuds go on sale today for $349. Timekettle has made a name for itself thanks to its translation earbuds . Its recent W4 Pro earbuds automatically translate dozens of languages during speech and calls. Now, the company has announced a new pair of buds. The Timekettle W4 AI Interpreter Earbuds are effectively a less premium version of the W4 Pro buds. However, the standard W4 also differs by offering a conventional earbud design versus the Pro modelâ€™s open-ear form factor.

title: Lenovo shows off a concept laptop with a display that rotates to portrait mode
summary: It's one a kind, but we've seen a similar concept before â€” from another brand.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Lenovo has showcased a new concept laptop with a rotating display. The display features a special mechanism that allows switching between landscape and portrait orientations. The concept isnâ€™t coming to the market yet, though it looks close to ready for production. Weâ€™ve seen laptops with dual screens . Weâ€™ve seen laptops with flexible screens that unfold into larger ones . Weâ€™ve even seen laptops with rolling screens that expand for a bigger real estate . Many of these concept-turned-products were showcased by Lenovo, which is now taking unveiling a new concept with another unusual screen layout. This new concept laptop, showcased at IFA 2025 today, embodies the rising trend for portrait monitors with a screen that swivels between portrait and landscape orientations. Lenovoâ€™s new ThinkBook VertiFlex is a proof of concept for a laptop with a screen that rotates along its center. The laptop, internally referred to as Project Pivo, features a 14-inch screen anchored to a mechanism that allows using the same screen in both orientations.

title: The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is finally here to put the ROG Xbox Ally in its place

body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is an updated 8.8-inch Windows handheld. Like the ROG Xbox Ally X, it packs a Z2 Extreme chip, but with a better screen and more RAM. Pricing will start at $1,049, with availability starting in October. Itâ€™s been nearly nine months since Lenovo first showed off the Legion Go 2 prototype at CES, but at long last, itâ€™s finally here to take the spotlight. And boy was it worth it. The updated Windows handheld features top-notch specs across the board. We donâ€™t have all of the SKUs yet, but the specs announced at IFA today list â€œup toâ€ the AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme and 32GB of RAM. The ROG Xbox Ally X, which was finally revealed last month , ships with the same chip, but maxes out at 24GB of RAM.

title: Pixel 10 phones are currently incompatible with Galaxy Watches
summary: We can confirm what countless Pixel 10 owners are reporting. The phones are refusing to pair with Samsung's watches.
body: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Watches are having trouble connecting to Pixel 10 series phones right now. Google seems to be aware of the problem, but itâ€™s unclear if a fix is coming anytime soon. If you just picked up a shiny new Pixel 10 series phone and tried pairing it with your Galaxy Watch, chances are youâ€™re running into some connectivity trouble. Reports are piling up across Reddit and Googleâ€™s support forums that Samsungâ€™s watches, especially the Galaxy Watch 8 series, Galaxy Watch 7 series, and Galaxy Watch Ultra, simply refuse to connect to Googleâ€™s flagships over Bluetooth, and we can confirm the issue is very real. On our end, a Galaxy Watch 8 Classic wouldnâ€™t pair at all with the Pixel 10 Pro XL. The setup stops dead at the pairing code stage, whether through the Galaxy Wearable app or manual Bluetooth settings. Resetting the watch and reinstalling Samsung Health as well as the Galaxy Wearable app didnâ€™t help either. We also didnâ€™t have any luck pairing the two together after installing the latest September update on the Pixel 10 Pro XL. Meanwhile, the watcâ€¦

body: 6 Min Read Upcoming Launch to Boost NASAâ€™s Study of Sunâ€™s Influence Across Space Soon, there will be three new ways to study the Sunâ€™s influence across the solar system with the launch of a trio of NASA and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) spacecraft. Expected to launch no earlier than Tuesday, Sept. 23, the missions include NASAâ€™s IMAP (Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe), NASAâ€™s Carruthers Geocorona Observatory, and NOAAâ€™s SWFO-L1 (Space Weather Follow On-Lagrange 1) spacecraft. The three missions will launch together aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. From there, the spacecraft will travel together to their destination at the first Earth-Sun Lagrange point (L1), around one million miles from Earth toward the Sun. The missions will each focus on different effects of the solar wind â€” the continuous stream of particles emitted by the Sun â€” and space weather â€” the changing conditions in space driven by the Sun â€” from their origins at the Sun to their farthest reaches billions of miles away at the edge of our solar system. Research and observations from the missions will help us better understand the Sunâ€™s inflâ€¦

body: NASA NASA astronauts Jonny Kim and Zena Cardman , both Expedition 73 Flight Engineers, pose for a portrait inside the International Space Station ‘s Unity module during a break in weekend housecleaning and maintenance activities. Kim and Cardman are both part of NASA Astronaut Group 22 selected in June 2017 with 12 other astronauts, including two Canadian Space Agency astronauts, and affectionately nicknamed “The Turtles.” In its third decade of continuous human presence, the space station has a far-reaching impact as a microgravity lab hosting technology, demonstrations, and scientific investigations from a range of fields. The research done by astronauts on the orbiting laboratory will inform long-duration missions like Artemis and future human expeditions to Mars . Learn more about station activities by following the  space station blog .

Robot vacuum cleaners have spent the past twenty years transforming the way millions of us keep our living spaces neat and clean, and theyâ€™ve been getting more useful and versatile this entire time. From automatic room mapping, to mopping floors, to even picking up after us with an articulated arm , manufacturers have been inching us towards a future where tidying up just isnâ€™t a chore we need to worry ourselves with. But those of us spread across multiple floors have been at a disadvantage, stuck hauling the vacuum around, dealing with multiple units, or just cleaning some of our spaces manually (god forbid).

title: NASA Contract Officer Helps Power Journey Back to the Moon
summary: When NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission launches in 2026, it will inspire the world through discovery in a new Golden Age of innovation and exploration. It will be another inspiring NASA moment Patricia White can add to her growing list. White supports the Artemis program to send astronauts to the Moon to pâ€¦
body: Patricia White is a contracting officer at NASAâ€™s Stennis Space Center, where she contributes to NASAâ€™s Artemis program that will send astronauts to the Moon to prepare for future human exploration of Mars. NASA/Danny Nowlin When NASA’s Artemis II mission launches in 2026, it will inspire the world through discovery in a new Golden Age of innovation and exploration. It will be another inspiring NASA moment Patricia White can add to her growing list. White supports the Artemis program to send astronauts to the Moon to prepare for future human exploration of Mars as a contracting officer at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi. White takes special pride in the test operations contract she helped draft. The contract provides support to the Fred Haise Test Stand, which tests the RS-25 engines that will help power NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket on Artemis missions. “I was awestruck the first time I witnessed an engine test,” White said. “I remember how small I felt in comparison to this big and fascinating world, and I wondered what that engine would see that I would never be able to see.” Four RS-25 engines testâ€¦

title: NASA Glenn Tests Mini-X-Ray Technology to Advance Space Health Care
summary: As NASA plans future human exploration missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond, new and unique challenges emerge â€” like communication delays and limited return-to-Earth options â€” so enhanced medical care capabilities are critical. Crews will need non-invasive imaging technology to diagnose medical câ€¦
body: 4 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) Researchers Kelly Gilkey, Cy Peverill, Daniel Phan, Chase Haddix, and Ariel Tokarz test portable, handheld X-ray systems for use during future long-duration space missions at NASAâ€™s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland on Friday, March 21, 2025. Credit: NASA/Sara Lowthian-Hanna As NASA plans future human exploration missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond, new and unique challenges emerge â€” like communication delays and limited return-to-Earth options â€” so enhanced medical care capabilities are critical. Crews will need non-invasive imaging technology to diagnose medical conditions, like broken bones or dental injuries.   Scientists at NASAâ€™s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland are testing portable, handheld X-ray systems for use during future extended space missions. Having portable X-ray capabilities aboard spacecraft would allow astronauts to immediately assess and treat potential injuries or identify equipment issues without having to disassemble the gear.  â€œTechnological innovations like that of the mini-X-ray will help keep our astronauts healthy as we endeavor farther into space than â€¦

body: If Iâ€™m honest, Google made me a little nervous when it introduced the Pixel 10 series . Not because I thought it was about to ruin the things I love about its flagships, but because it seemed like Google was starting to run out of ideas for clever software features. title: As a cell phone expert, Iâ€™m worried about the future of prepaid carriers
summary: Prepaid in 2025 is 100x better than its ever been, but there is one trend that concerns me.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Once dismissed as the domain of teenagers, bad credit consumers, or even shady activity, prepaid wireless has transformed into a real competitor in the smartphone age. Today, the prepaid market offers everything from ultra-budget choices to services that deliver an experience nearly indistinguishable from premium postpaid service. But this evolution comes with a new concern: over-saturation. There are now well over a dozen reputable prepaid carriers, along with a seemingly endless wave of smaller providers. In 2025 alone, at least five new mobile services have either been announced or even launched already, including Klarna Mobile , SmartLess Mobile, Trump Mobile , Gerald BNPL Mobile, and an upcoming service from MrBeast . All of these are either tied to celebrity endorsements or backed by brands that have traditionally had no connection to wireless.

title: Microsoft made a free YouTube Premium workaround, but Iâ€™m keeping my paid sub anyway
summary: YouTube Premium is more than just ad blocking and background playback.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority A couple of days ago, Microsoft Edgeâ€™s latest Canary version added a new and very intriguing feature: video background playback . While the feature seemed cool and innocuous at first glance, we discovered that it could be used to play YouTube videos in the background without paying for a Premium subscription. Better yet, Microsoft Edge also has a built-in ad-blocker that can remove ads while watching YouTube. A plus B equal the two most useful perks from a YouTube Premium subscription can now be had for free with Edge. This all sounds too good to be true, so I immediately put it to the test to see how well it works. It actually does. I played several videos without encountering a single ad, and switched back and forth between tabs and apps, without breaking a sweat; the video kept going in the background. I even turned my screen off, and the video continued playing.

Extended Mode allows dragging apps and files between your monitor and tablet display. Launching with the Tab S11, this will reach older Samsung tablets with the One UI 8 update. Samsung DeX is one of the best desktop modes on mobile and has been a useful tool since it was introduced on the Galaxy S8. Samsung overhauled DeX in One UI 8 , basing it on Android 16â€™s new Desktop Mode, but there are more new features to come. The Galaxy Tab S11 gives DeX users a long-requested multi-monitor feature.

title: The Galaxy S25 FE is finally here, and thereâ€™s good and bad news

Now, Samsung has made it official and finally pulled the curtain back on the Galaxy S25 FE. Those hoping for a giant leap forward in most areas might be disappointed, but the new phone still brings a few key hardware upgrades that make it stand out from the Galaxy S24 FE. Furthermore, the device also brings some software features previously seen on the Galaxy S25 series and Z7 foldables.

The updated version improves ease of switching between regular Android and DeX mode without closing apps. When using the standalone tablet view, traditional navigation buttons and quick settings are absent, resulting in a less mouse-friendly experience. Android 16 introduced Googleâ€™s take on a Desktop Mode for Android, and the new version of Samsung DeX is based on it. While some of the changes are welcome , there are some downsides to the latest version of DeX. The Galaxy Tab S11 series gives us our first look at the new DeX on a tablet, and some of these updates might not sit well with everyone.

These tablets come with incremental changes over the previous Galaxy Tab S10 series, and weâ€™ll walk you through all of those. Letâ€™s start with the immediately apparent change: the naming. The handset has hit a brand-new record-low price of just $599.99. This means youâ€™re saving a whopping $400! Buy the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge for just $599.99 ($400 off)

title: A rugby 'miracle' and gay friendly - why  Brighton is perfect World Cup host
summary: England face Australia in Brighton on Saturday, with women's rugby in a "special place" for the LGBTQ+ community.

title: Gboardâ€™s new AI Writing Tools are coming to more Android phones
summary: Gboardâ€™s Writing Tools feature lets you proofread or rephrase your text without uploading it to the cloud
body: Gboardâ€™s AI-powered Writing Tools feature, which debuted on the Pixel 10, is now rolling out to some non-Pixel devices. Powered by the on-device Gemini Nano model, the feature helps users proofread and rephrase text directly within the keyboard. Availability is tied to devices supporting the multimodal Gemini Nano, such as those with the latest high-end chipsets. Update 1, September 3, 2025 (2:45 PM ET): Google has confirmed that Gboardâ€™s AI Writing Tools feature is coming to more Android phones, but a footnote reveals that the feature will only be available on devices with â€œGemini Nano v2 or higher.â€ This means only devices with the multimodal version of Gemini Nano will support the feature. Flagship phones with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite, MediaTek Dimensity 9400, and Exynos 2500 support this version of Gemini Nano, so itâ€™s only a matter of time before the feature rolls out to them. Original article, September 2, 2025 (10:35 AM ET): When Google unveiled the Pixel 10 series last month, the company highlighted new AI features that take advantage of the phonesâ€™ hardware. One of these is Writing Tools in Gboard , which can help you proofread or rephrase your text, saving you froâ€¦

title: Samsung Health levels up with virtual doctor visits, on-demand workouts, and more
summary: Samsung Health will soon offer virtual doctor visits, guided workouts, and better prescription management.
body: Credit: Samsung Samsung is collaborating with three partners to add new features to the Health app. These features include telehealth visits, enhanced prescription management, and expert-guided workouts. These features will start rolling out on September 8. Itâ€™s always nice when an app gets new features. Thatâ€™s exactly whatâ€™s happening with the Samsung Health app soon. The update will introduce new features enabled by three new partnerships. Samsung has announced that it has collaborated with three different companies to roll out three new features for the Health app. These companies include HealthTap, Walgreens, and iFIT.

title: Earbud sharing begone: Pixel phones now have proper support for Auracast
summary: Google is joining Xiaomi and Samsung in offering full Auracast support.
body: Credit: Supplied by Google Google has announced that Auracast is now available on recent Pixel phones. This lets you broadcast Bluetooth audio or tune into Bluetooth broadcasts from others. It also comes months after Google introduced Auracast support on Pixels, but only for compatible hearing aids. Google announced Auracast support for the Pixel 9 series earlier this year, but this was initially restricted to compatible hearing aids . Now, the company has announced full-fledged Auracast support for recent Pixel phones . Auracast is part of the Bluetooth LE Audio standard, and this feature allows you to broadcast Bluetooth audio or tune into Bluetooth audio broadcasts from others. This means you donâ€™t have to give one earbud to a friend if you want to listen to music together, as you can broadcast the audio to multiple pairs of earbuds and headphones. This is also useful for situations like sightseeing, as the guide or establishment can broadcast audio to your existing Bluetooth earphones. Google also points to examples like staying informed at the airport or listening to TV at the gym.

title: Googleâ€™s beloved Androidify app is back with new features for making your own Android Bot
summary: The new Androidify app uses AI to create an Android Bot that you can use on your social media profile
body: Google has relaunched its Androidify app, now using AI to create custom Android Bot avatars from your photos or text prompts. The new app leverages Googleâ€™s Gemini 2.5 Flash and Imagen AI models to analyze your input and generate a highly personalized Bot. You can further customize your creation with various backgrounds and export it as an image, sticker, or even a short video. Back in 2023, Google unveiled its new Android branding , complete with a new 3D mascot called the â€˜Botâ€™. The Android Bot is beloved by many, as its adorable physique complements almost any color scheme and accessory thrown on it. Last year, Google released a Bot builder tool that lets you create your own Android avatar, but its customization options were quite limited. Now, Google is back with a new app that leverages the power of AI to let you create a fully custom Android Bot that reflects your unique look. This new app is a revival of a much-loved classic: Androidify. First released in 2011, the original Androidify app let you create a custom version of the Android mascot, allowing you to tweak its skin tone, clothing, hair type, and accessories â€” an extensive level of customization for the time. Google â€¦

title: Thinning Arctic Sea Ice
summary: Sea ice is frozen seawater that floats in the ocean. This photo, taken from NASAâ€™s Gulfstream V Research Aircraft on July 21, 2022, shows Arctic sea ice in the Lincoln Sea north of Greenland. This image is the NASA Science Image of the Month for September 2025. Each month, NASAâ€™s Science Mission Diâ€¦
body: NASA/Rachel Tilling Sea ice is frozen seawater that floats in the ocean. This photo, taken from NASAâ€™s Gulfstream V Research Aircraft on July 21, 2022, shows Arctic sea ice in the Lincoln Sea north of Greenland. This image is the  NASA Science Image of the Month for September 2025 . Each month, NASAâ€™s Science Mission Directorate chooses an image to feature, offering desktop wallpaper downloads, as well as links to related topics, activities, and games. Text and image credit: NASA/Rachel Tilling
